questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A TV transmitting antenna is 98 m high and the receiving antenna is at the ground level. If the radius of the earth is 6400 km, the surface area covered by the transmitting antenna is approximately:

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: The engine of a train moving with speed 10 ms⁻¹ towards a platform sounds a whistle at frequency 400 Hz. The frequency heard by a passenger inside the train is: (neglect air speed. Speed of sound in air = 330 ms⁻¹)
questions.concept: Apparent frequency for moving source and observer

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: Graphical variation of electric field due to a uniformly charged insulating solid sphere of radius R, with distance r from the centre O is represented by:
questions.concept: Electric field inside and outside uniformly charged sphere

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: For the logic circuit shown, the output waveform at Y is:

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: At any instant the velocity of a particle of mass 500 g is (2t î + 3t² ĵ) ms⁻¹. If the force acting on the particle at t = 1s is (î + x ĵ) N. Then the value of x will be:

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: Dimension of 1/(μ₀ε₀) should be equal to

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: In a reflecting telescope, a secondary mirror is used to:

options.text: reduce the problem of mechanical support
move the eyepiece outside the telescopic tube

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A charge particle moving in magnetic field B, has the components of velocity along B as well as perpendicular to B. The path of the charge particle will be:

options.text: Helical path with the axis perpendicular to the direction of magnetic field B
Helical path with the axis along magnetic field B
Straight along the direction of magnetic field B

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: Certain galvanometers have a fixed core made of non-magnetic metallic material. The function of this metallic material is

options.text: to bring the coil to rest quickly
to make the magnetic field radial
to produce large deflecting torque on the coil
to oscillate the coil in magnetic field for longer period of time

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A cylindrical wire of mass (0.4 ± 0.01) g has length (8 ± 0.04) cm and radius (6 ± 0.03) mm. The maximum error in its density will be:

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: In this figure the resistance of the coil of galvanometer G is 2 Ω. The emf of the cell is 4 V. The ratio of potential difference across C₁ and C₂ is:

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: Two forces having magnitude A and A/2 are perpendicular to each other. The magnitude of their resultant is:

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText:
Given below are two statements:
Statement I: If heat is added to a system, its temperature must increase.
Statement II: If positive work is done by a system in a thermodynamic process, its volume must increase.
In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below

options.text: Statement I is false but Statement II is true
Both Statement I and Statement II are false
Both Statement I and Statement II are true
Statement I is true but Statement II is false

questions.concept: Heat, work and internal energy relations

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText:
For a nucleus ᴬzX having mass number A and atomic number Z
(A) The surface energy per nucleon (bₛ) = -a₁ A²/³
(B) The Coulomb contribution to the binding energy bc = -a₂ Z(Z-1)/A³/⁴
(C) The volume energy bᵥ = a₃A
(D) Decrease in the binding energy is proportional to surface area.
(E) While estimating the surface energy, it is assumed that each nucleon interacts with 12 nucleons. (a₁, a₂ and a₃ are constants)
Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: Proton (P) and electron (e) will have same de-Broglie wavelength when the ratio of their momentum is (assume, mₚ = 1849 mₑ):

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: The weight of a body on the earth is 400 N. Then weight of the body when taken to a depth half of the radius of the earth will be:
questions.concept: Acceleration due to gravity at depth

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: An aluminium rod with Young's modulus Y = 7.0 × 10¹⁰ N/m² undergoes elastic strain of 0.04%. The energy per unit volume stored in the rod in SI unit is:

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText:
Given below are two statements:
Statement I: If E be the total energy of a satellite moving around the earth, then its potential energy will be E/2
Statement II: The kinetic energy of a satellite revolving in an orbit is equal to the half the magnitude of total energy E.
In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below

options.text: Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct
Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect
Both Statement I and Statement II are correct
Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: Two projectiles A and B are thrown with initial velocities of 40 m/s and 60 m/s at angles 30° and 60° with the horizontal respectively. The ratio of their ranges respectively is (g = 10 m/s²)

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: An air bubble of volume 1 cm³ rises from the bottom of a lake 40 m deep to the surface at a temperature of 12°C. The atmospheric pressure is 1 × 10⁵ Pa, the density of water is 1000 kg/m³ and g = 10 m/s². There is no difference of the temperature of water at the depth of 40 m and on the surface. The volume of air bubble when it reaches the surface will be:

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: An organ pipe 40 cm long is open at both ends. The speed of sound in air is 360 ms⁻¹. The frequency of the second harmonic is ____ Hz.

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: Two vertical parallel mirrors A and B are separated by 10 cm. A point object O is placed at a distance of 2 cm from mirror A. The distance of the second nearest image behind mirror A from the mirror A is ____ cm

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: The magnetic intensity at the center of a long current carrying solenoid is found to be 1.6 × 10³ Am⁻¹. If the number of turns is 8 per cm, then the current flowing through the solenoid is ______ A.

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: The momentum of a body is increased by 50%. The percentage increase in the kinetic energy of the body is ____ %
questions.concept: Relation between kinetic energy and momentum

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: An oscillating LC circuit consists of a 75 mH inductor and a 1.2 µF capacitor. If the maximum charge to the capacitor is 2.7 μC. The maximum current in the circuit will be _____mA

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: An electric dipole of dipole moment is 6.0 × 10⁻⁶ Cm placed in a uniform electric field of 1.5 × 10³ NC⁻¹ in such a way that dipole moment is along electric field. The work done in rotating dipole by 180° in this field will be______mJ.

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A current of 2 A flows through a wire of cross-sectional area 25.0 mm². The number of free electrons in a cubic meter are 2.0 × 10²⁸. The drift velocity of the electrons is ______× 10⁻⁶ ms⁻¹ (given, charge on electron = 1.6 × 10⁻¹⁹ C).

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A nucleus with mass number 242 and binding energy per nucleon as 7.6 MeV breaks into two fragment each with mass number 121. If each fragment nucleus has binding energy per nucleon as 8.1 MeV, the total gain in binding energy is _____ MeV

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: The moment of inertia of a semi-circular ring about an axis, passing through the centre and perpendicular to the plane of ring, is (1/x)MR², where R is the radius and M is the mass of the semi-circular ring. The value of x will be ____.
questions.concept: Moment of inertia of semi-circular ring

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: An air bubble of diameter 6 mm rises steadily through a solution of density 1750 kg/m³ at the rate of 0.35 cm/s. The co-efficient of viscosity of the solution (neglect density of air) is _____Pas (given, g = 10 ms⁻²).
